title: TVLine Items: Southern Charm Star Quits, Claire Danes’ Netflix Thriller Adds Breaking Bad Vet and More
description: Southern Charm is officially down one gentleman. Jarrett Thomas (aka “JT”) announced on Friday that he has “resigned” from the Bravo reality show after two seasons. “Yesterday I informed Bravo that I will not be participating in the … remaining green room interviews [before Season 10 airs], and that I no longer wish to participate […]
author: Andy Swift
excerpt: Find out which 'Southern Charm' star is calling it quits after Season 10, plus more of today's big TV news.
text: Southern Charm is officially down one gentleman. Jarrett Thomas (aka “JT”) announced on Friday that he has “resigned” from the Bravo reality show after two seasons. Courtesy of Bravo “Yesterday I informed Bravo that I will not be participating in the … remaining green room interviews [before Season 10 airs], and that I no longer wish to participate in any ways moving forward with the TV show,” Thomas wrote in an Instagram post. “I will leave it at that for now, while I work on next steps to recover both physically and mentally from what has been an extremely challenging and exhausting year.” Thomas’ announcement was met with support from fans and former co-stars, including Cameran Eubanks Wimberly, who commented that “nothing is more valuable than your peace.” Southern Charm Season 10, which will be Thomas’ last, premieres Thursday, Dec. 5 on Bravo. Ready for more of today’s newsy nuggets? Well… * Nine actors have joined the cast of Netflix‘s Claire Danes/Matthew Rhys-led thriller The Beast in Me. Those actors include Jonathan Banks (Breaking Bad), Will Brill (Fellow Travelers), Kate Burton (Grey’s Anatomy), Bill Irwin (Legion), Deirdre O’Connell (The Penguin), Hettienne Park (The Last of Us), Aleyse Shannon (Leverage: Redemption), Amir Arison (The Blacklist) and Julie Ann Emery (Better Call Saul). * The CW has acquired the rights to former CBS comedy Bob Hearts Abishola, which ran for five seasons and ended in May. Repeats will air Fridays at 8/7c, beginning Nov. 15. (edited)
html:
Southern Charm is officially down one gentleman. Jarrett Thomas (aka “JT”) announced on Friday that he has “resigned” from the Bravo reality show after two seasons.

“Yesterday I informed Bravo that I will not be participating in the … remaining green room interviews [before Season 10 airs], and that I no longer wish to participate in any ways moving forward with the TV show,” Thomas wrote in an Instagram post. “I will leave it at that for now, while I work on next steps to recover both physically and mentally from what has been an extremely challenging and exhausting year.”

Thomas’ announcement was met with support from fans and former co-stars, including Cameran Eubanks Wimberly, who commented that “nothing is more valuable than your peace.”

Southern Charm Season 10, which will be Thomas’ last, premieres Thursday, Dec. 5 on Bravo.

Ready for more of today’s newsy nuggets? Well…

* Nine actors have joined the cast of Netflix‘s Claire Danes/Matthew Rhys-led thriller The Beast in Me. Those actors include Jonathan Banks (Breaking Bad), Will Brill (Fellow Travelers), Kate Burton (Grey’s Anatomy), Bill Irwin (Legion), Deirdre O’Connell (The Penguin), Hettienne Park (The Last of Us), Aleyse Shannon (Leverage: Redemption), Amir Arison (The Blacklist) and Julie Ann Emery (Better Call Saul).

* The CW has acquired the rights to former CBS comedy Bob Hearts Abishola, which ran for five seasons and ended in May. Repeats will air Fridays at 8/7c, beginning Nov. 15. (edited)
